title: The launch of CEMROL: the charms and challenges of developing an academic crowdsourcing platform

The project started in 2018, so very recently at the University of Utrecht, but it is funded by the European Research Council and our project studies what we call the Republic of Letters, the scientific community that existed in Europe between roughly 1500 and 1800s.
The early modern.

Our team, consisting of PHD's an postdocs, studies, for example, the social networks of scholars in the early modern days, the ways in which scholars related to the ideal of sharing knowledge and methods they use to communicate this ideal to future generations.
We all study very different different aspects, but our data and our approach is similar.
We combine methods of digital humanities as well as traditional methods so close and distant reading, and we focus mainly on.

This was their email, their social media, their main means of communication.

They discussed the news.
